node.title: How many people have been vaccinated in Wales?
node.description: The vaccine programme is focusing on booster jabs and first doses for 12 to 15-year-olds.

node.title: Where the UK's recycling really goes
node.description: As Boris Johnson says we have to cut our use of plastic, where does our recycling and rubbish go?

node.title: A simple guide to Budget 2021
node.description: The Budget - when is it, what does it do and what should we expect to hear from the chancellor?

node.title: Why is the cost of living going up?
node.description: Energy bills, petrol prices and other daily costs are putting the pinch on household budgets.

node.title: What's the plan to manage Covid this winter?
node.description: Health service figures are calling for stricter Covid restrictions in England to protect the NHS.

node.title: Figuring out the stats on coronavirus in Wales
node.description: What is happening in your area - and what are the figures telling us?

node.title: Why is there a Brexit fishing row?
node.description: Fishing licences near Jersey are threatening trade relations between the UK and France.

node.title: Why Brexit still has a Northern Ireland problem
node.description: The UK could decide to suspend parts of the Brexit deal for Northern Ireland, known as the protocol.

node.title: Marie Antoinette's bracelets sell for $8 million
node.description: The diamond bracelets of the last queen of France were sold to an anonymous telephone bidder.

node.title: Why is cladding unsafe and what is it costing residents?
node.description: The housing secretary is unhappy at leaseholders being asked to cover the costs of repairs.

node.title: Poland fears Belarus plans armed border escalation
node.description: It comes after hundreds of migrants tried to cut a barbed-wire fence and enter Poland illegally.

node.title: US urges China to free jailed citizen journalist
node.description: Zhang Zhan has been in jail since May 2020 for her on-the-ground coverage of Covid-19 in Wuhan.

node.title: Evergrande raises cash just ahead of debt deadline
node.description: The firm faces another deadline this week to make overdue interest payments of $148m.

node.title: Family prays as man with low IQ set to be executed
node.description: The drug trafficking case has sparked a rare disquiet in Singapore where the death penalty is largely uncontroversial.

node.title: Black Caps and England go head to head again
node.description: Two years since in a thrilling 50-overs World Cup final, England and New Zealand will again seek to deliver a knockout blow at the T20 World Cup.

node.title: Covid-19: Collins supports vaccine mandates, but not forever
node.description: Most National Party MPs have got back into the same room together - with a caucus meeting made possible after politicians' travel restrictions out of Auckland were lifted. Audio

node.title: Belarus president lashed for 'inhuman' migrant crisis
node.description: The European Commission has accused Belarus's authoritarian leader of luring migrants with the false promise of easy entry to the EU as part of an "inhuman, gangster-style approach".

node.title: World headed for 2.4C warming despite climate summit - report
node.description: Despite pledges made at the climate summit COP26, the world is still nowhere near its goals on limiting global temperature rise, a new analysis shows.

node.title: Coal burning pushes rise in NZ emissions
node.description: New Zealand's industry and household greenhouse gas emissions rose 4.8 percent in the three months to June, mainly off the back of coal burning to generate electricity.

node.title: U.S. Holocaust Museum Says China ‘May Be Committing Genocide’ Against Uyghurs
node.description: Its report found that the government’s attacks against the group of Muslims in Xinjiang had escalated and most likely included “forced sterilization, sexual violence, enslavement, torture, and forcible transfer.”

node.title: NFL Levies Fines to Aaron Rodgers, Green Bay Packers for Breaking COVID Protocols
node.description: The team was fined $300,000 while Rodgers and another player were each fined $14,650.

node.title: 41yo truck driver charged over ambulance crash killing nurse and elderly patient
node.description: A man has been charged over the deaths of nurse Ray Wyeth and his 87-year-old patient, who were killed when his truck hit the ambulance they were travelling in west of Rockhampton last month.

node.title: Teenage driver and passenger accused of breaching WA hard border by speeding through checkpoint
node.description: A 17-year-old boy driving from New South Wales and his 24-year-old passenger are charged after their car allegedly sped through the West Australian border checkpoint at Eucla, failing to stop for police.

node.title: Dutch government rejects hundreds of millions of pieces of protective gear.
node.description: By Claire Moses

node.title: Macron announces a new vaccine rule for people 65 or older in France.
node.description: Though the country has a high vaccination rate, new coronavirus cases and hospital admissions have been increasing in recent weeks.

node.title: Facial recognition tech put on hold in Adelaide amidst privacy concerns
node.description: Some $3 million will be spent on a new Adelaide surveillance network, but a council proposal passed overnight means police cannot access its facial recognition capabilities without laws to protect privacy.

node.title: Up-and-coming Hawthorn player tests positive to COVID-19
node.description: Finn Maginness is in quarantine, as Hawthorn confirms all its players have had at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.
